title: What time is the Bake Off final tonight and who is in it?
text:
The Great British Bake Off 2019 is about to reveal its winner (Picture: Love Productions / Channel 4 / Mark Bourdillon)

After weeks of cake triumphs, bread brilliance and the odd dessert disaster, it’s finally time to crown the winner of The Great British Bake Off 2019.

Just three people remain in the tent after impressing Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith with their baking prowess every single week – and now just three more bakes stand between them and the coveted series title.

Of course things aren’t going to be made easy for them – with the final promising a tricky chocolate cake challenge and one of the most complicated showstoppers they’ve yet had to face.

It’s going to be must-see Tuesday night TV – but what time is it on, and who will be competing?

Here’s what you need to know…

What time is The Great British Bake Off final on tonight?

Advertisement

Advertisement

The final of The Great British Bake Off is on Channel 4 on Tuesday night at 8pm.

First there were 13, now just three remain (Picture: Channel 4)

It runs for an hour and a quarter, with the winner crowned just before the end of the show.

Tonight’s show will see contestants tackling chocolate cake for their signature bake – with souffles on the menu for the technical.

Meanwhile they’ll wrap up the series with an ‘edible illusion’ showstopper ahead of the champion being determined.

Who is in the final of The Great British Bake Off?

Will Steph, David or Alice be your 2019 winner? (Picture: Channel 4)

Those who have made it to the final are Steph Blackwell, David Atherton and Alice Fevronia

The trio reached the all-important final after Rosie Brandreth-Poynter was eliminated from the series in the semi-final last week.

Steph is currently 4-5 favourite to win after nabbing the coveted Star Baker accolade four times during the series.

‘Steph is the one to beat tonight as she has consistently delivered throughout this series so it will be no surprise if she is rewarded with victory in the final,’ said Coral’s John Hill.

Alice – who has been Star Baker twice – is second favourite at 2-1, while David is the outsider at 4-1.

As well as the finalists Tuesday’s show will also see a welcome return for the rest of this year’s contestants, who will join their families in a party outside the tent ahead of the winner being crowned.

Steph is the one to beat tonight as she has consistently delivered throughout this series so it will be no surprise if she is rewarded with victory in the final
description: The Great British Bake Off 2019 is set to crown its winner - but just what time does the final kick off and who is left in the tent?
